SEARCH
Package com.github.oeuvres.alix.lucene

Class Alix

java.lang.Object
com.github.oeuvres.alix.lucene.Alix
public class Alix extends Object

An Alix object is a wrapper around a Lucene index with lexical tools, to be shared across a complex application (ex: web servlet). Instantiation is not public to ensure uniqueness of threadsafe Lucene objects (Directory, IndexReader, IndexSearcher, IndexWriter and Analyzer). Use instance(String) to get an Alix instance, and get from it what you need for your classical Lucene bizness.

  • reader()
  • writer()
  • searcher()
  • analyzer()

An Alix object will also produce different lists and stats concerning all index. These results are cached cache(String, Object) (to avoid recalculation). Data are usually available as custom objects, optimized for statistics.

  • fieldInt(String) All values of a unique numeric field per document (IntPoint, NumericDocValuesField).
  • fieldText(String) All search indexed in a TextField, with stats, useful for list of search and advanced lexical statistics.
  • fieldFacet(String) All search of a facet field (SortedDocValuesField or SortedSetDocValuesField) with lexical statistics from a TextField (ex: count of words for an author facet)
  • scale(String, String) Data to build chronologies or other charts.

    • books

      Get docId parent documents (books) of nested documents (chapters), sorted by a sort specification.
      Parameters:
      sort - Sort specification to get a list of books.

      An ordered linst of docid.

      Parameters:
      key - The key of a cached Object.
      Returns:

    • cache

      public void cache(String key, Object o)
      A simple cache. Will be cleared if index reader is renewed. Use SoftReference as a value, so that Garbage Collector will silently delete object references in case of Out of memory.
      Parameters:
      key - Name to get back the Object.
      o - Cached Object.

    • docStore

      public String[] docStore(String field, String[] load) throws IOException
      Get stored values in docId order. Be careful, not efifcient.
      Parameters:
      field - Field name.
      load - Optional array to populate.
      Returns:
      An array in docid order with the int value retrieved.
      Throws:
      IOException - Lucene errors.

    • fieldFacet

      public FieldFacet fieldFacet(String fieldName) throws IOException
      Get a “facet” object, a cached list of search from a field of type SortedDocValuesField or SortedSetDocValuesField ; to get lexical stats from a text field. An optional “term” (field:value) maybe used to catch a “cover” document (ex: a document carrying metada about a title or an author).
      Parameters:
      fieldName - A SortedDocValuesField or a SortedSetDocValuesField fieldName.
      Returns:
      The facet.
      Throws:
      IOException - Lucene errors.

    • fieldInt

      public FieldInt fieldInt(String fieldName) throws IOException
      Get a list of intPoint (ex: year) in docid order.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - An intPoint field name.
      Returns:
      An array in docId order with the value of an intPoint field
      Throws:
      IOException - Lucene errors.

    • getDocId

      public int getDocId(String id) throws IOException
      Get the internal lucene docid of a document by Alix String id (a reserved field name)
      Parameters:
      id - A document id provided at indexation.
      Returns:
      The Lucene docId, or -1 if not found, or -2 if too much found, or -3 if id was null or empty.
      Throws:
      IOException - Lucene errors.

    • scale

      public Scale scale(String fieldInt, String fieldText) throws IOException
      Get a Scale object, useful to build graphs and chronology with an int field.
      Parameters:
      fieldInt - A NumericDocValuesField used as a sorted value.

    • tokenize

      public String[] tokenize(String q, String fieldName) throws IOException
      Analyze a search according to the default analyzer of this base, is especially needed for multi-words ex: "en effet" return search as an array of string, supposing that caller knows the field he wants to search.
      Parameters:
      q - A search query.
      fieldName - Name of text field.
      Returns:
      Analyzed terms to search in index.
      Throws:
      IOException - Lucene errors.
